meanings.definition: To surpass in seeing or understanding.
meanings.sent1: She outsees her classmates in solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: The eagle outsees other birds with its keen eyesight.
meanings.sent3: The detective outsees the criminal's plan and solves the case.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition outsees logic when making important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The scientist outsees the mysteries of the universe with groundbreaking research.

meanings.definition: To have a better view or perspective than someone else.
meanings.sent1: From the top of the hill, he outsees the entire town below.
meanings.sent2: The lookout tower outsees the surrounding forest for miles.
meanings.sent3: The cat outsees the dog from its perch on the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her balcony outsees the bustling city streets, offering a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outsees the rocky cliffs, guiding ships safely to shore.
